question.text:
Which of the following duties have been prescribed by the Indian Constitution as Fundamental Duties?
1. To defend the country
2. To pay income tax
3. To preserve the rich heritage of our composite culture
4. To safeguard public property
Select the correct answer using the codes given below:
Which one of the following has not been enumerated in the Constitution of India as be in amongst the fundamental duties of the citizens?

d.text: To value and preserve the rich heritage of our composite culture
To safeguard public property and to abjure violence
To develop the scientific temper, humanism and the spirit of inquiry and reform
To secure a social order for the promotion of welfare of the people

question.text: Which one of the following is not a fundamental duty?

d.text: To protect monuments and places of national importance
To protect and improve the natural environment

question.text:
Following duties have been prescribed for the State and the citizens:
1. To develop scientific temper
2. To promote common broodier hood
3. To organise village panchayats
4. To minimizse the inequalities in income
5. To secure a uniform civil code
6. To defend the country
Among these, the fundamental duties of the citizens would include:

Consider the following statements:
In view of Article 20 of the Constitution of India, no person accused of an offence can be com- palled to:
1. Give his signature or thumb impression for identification.
2. Give oral testimony either in or out of the court.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
Which one of the following pairs is not correct matched?

d.text: Freedom of speech and expression - Include the freedom of Press
Freedom of conscience - Include the right to wear and carry kirpans by Sikhs
Right to personal liberty - Include the right to carry on any trade or business
Right to equality - Include the principle of natural justice

question.text: Right to Education is a fundamental right emanating from right to:

d.text: Freedom of speech and expression under Article 19
Culture and education under Articles 29 and 30
Life and personal liberty under Article 21
Equality before law and equal protection of the laws under Article 14

question.text:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below:
List- I (Writs) List- II (Ground)
1. Habeas Corpus 1. Non-performance of public duties
2. Mandamus 2. Unlawful detention
3. Quo-Warranto 3. Correctional directions to subordinate courts
4. Certiorari 4. Unlawful occupation of public office
Codes:
As far as the Armed Forces are concerned, the Fundamental Rights granted under Articles 14 and 19 of Constitution are:

d.text: Available to the Armed Forces but not to other forces
Available only at the discretion of the Chief of the Army staff
Available only according to law made by Parliament

question.text: Which of the following rights is not explicitly mentioned in the Fundamental Rights but has been upheld to be so by several pronouncements of the Supreme Court?

d.text: Right to non-discrimination in public employment
Right to form associations or unions

question.text:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below:
List- I (provisions) List- II (contained In)
A. Liberty of thought and expression Right to freedom
B. Freedom of speech and expression Cultural and educations rights
C. Making special provision for women and children Preamble
D. Protection of interest of minorities Protection of life and liberty
Right to equality
Codes:

Assertion (A): One of the fundamental principles of the Indian Constitution is the Rule of Law.
Reason (R): The Constitution of India has guaranteed to every citizen the equality before law and has recognized the judiciary as the unfailing guardian of the rights of people.

d.text: Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

question.text:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below:
List- I (cases) List- II
A. Indra sawhney case 1. Power of parliament to amend part III of the constitution upheld
B. Minerva case 2. Procedure Established by law
C. Gopalan case 3. Reservation for backward classes
D. Shankari Prasad case 4. Revival of judicial review
Codes:
Which one of the following is the correct statement? Right to privacy as a Fundamental Right is implicit in:
The Right to Property was converted into a legal right from a Fundamental Right, because it:

d.text: Tied the hands of the government to prevent corruption
Gave rise to litigations that made judiciary overburden
Led to severe conflict between judiciary and the Parliament

question.text: Under Article 22 of the Constitution of India, with the exception of certain provisions stated therein, what is the maximum period for detention of a person under preventive detention?

Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below:
List- I (writ) List- II (purpose)
A. Writ of mandamus 1. Prohibition of an action
B. Writ of injunction 2. Direction to the official for the performance of a duty
C. Writ of certiorari 3. Trial of the right to title or elective office
D. Writ of quo- warrant 4. Transferring of a case from lower court to a court of higher jurisdiction
Codes:
In accordance with the text of the Constitution, a reasonable restriction in the interest of 'sover- eignty and integrity' of India can be imposed on the right to:

d.text: Move freely throughout the territory of India
Reside and settle in any part of the territory of India
Carry on any occupation, trade or business

question.text: Which one of the following is the best justification for the affirmative action policies in India?

Assertion (A): The Indian Constitution recognizes the supremacy of judiciary.
Reason (R): The question as to what constitutes a reasonable restriction on fundamental rights is to be determined by the courts of law.

d.text: Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

question.text: Which one of me following Fundamental Rights is guaranteed only to the citizens of India and not to the foreigners living in India?

d.text: Equably before law and equal protection of laws
Right to the freedom of religion

question.text: Reservation of seats in educational institutions in favour of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes is governed by:
Through which provisions does the Constitution of India explicitly prohibits racial discrimination in India?
Which one of the following rights cannot be inferred from Article 21 of the Constitution?
Which one of the following pairs is correctly matched?

d.text: Writ of habeas corpus - Available against private individuals as well
Writ of Quo - warranto - Available against subordinate courts only
Writ of certiorari - Available against autonomous bodies only
Writ of prohibition - Available against public servants only

question.text:
Assertion (A): Speaking on Article 32 in the Constituent Assembly, Dr. Ambedkar described the Article as the very soul of the Constitution.
Reason (R): Article 32 provides effective remedies against violation of fundamental rights.

d.text: Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

question.text:
Assertion (A): An accused person has been guaranteed the right to be informed of the nature and cause of accusation.
Reason (R): The accused person can get his conviction quashed upon vague and obscure charges.

d.text: Both A and R are individually true and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are individually true but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

question.text: Which of the following Article (s) of the Constitution of India is/are exceptions to the Funda- mental Rights enumerated in Article 14 or Article 19?

d.text: Article 31 A and Article 31 C both
Neither Article 31 A nor Article 31 C

question.text: Which one of the following writs examines the procedures of inferior Courts or Tribunals?
Untouchability has been abolished by the Constitution of India under:
According to the Constitution of India, which one of the following rights cannot be taken away during emergency?
Article 30 of the Indian Constitution deals with the:

d.text: Right of minorities to establish and manage educational institutions
Cultural and educational rights of the majority community

question.text: Annie Besant sought some rights but she did not insist on the following individual rights in her Home Rule Movement (1916)?

solution.text: Right to Constitutional Remedied was not included in Annie Besant?s list of rights in her 1916 home-rule campaign.

question.text: A memorandum circulated by Mahatma Gandhi at the second round table conference sought that any future Act should include

d.text: Protection of Minorities and their Cultures

solution.text: Gandhi ji sought protection of the interests and cultures of minorities.

question.text: The liberal school relating to rights discussed in the Constituent Assembly were led by

solution.text: Thakurdas Bhargava belonged to the liberal school propagating rights.

question.text:
Consider the following statements and choose the correct code:
1. The democratic left school of fundamental rights sought the provision of socioeconomic rights.
2. The liberal school of fundamental rights sought the provision of negative rights, though made non justifiable.

solution.text: Thirst statement is true but second is false.

question.text: Any law which is inconsistent with the fundamental rights

d.text: Stands void till the Parliament declares it so
Stands void till the President declares it so

solution.text: Stands void (Article 13)

question.text: Parliaments constituent powers are

solution.text: It is limited within the framework of basic structure.

question.text: Untouchability has been abolished by the Constitution of India under

solution.text: Abolition of Untouchability relates to Article 17.

question.text: Which of the following pairs is not correctly matched?

d.text: Equality before Law: Guaranteed to both citizens and non-citizens
Altering the name of a state: Power of a state legislature
Creating a new state: Power of Parliament
Equality of Opportunity: Guaranteed only to Indian Citizens

solution.text: Altering the name is initiated by the concerned state legislature.

question.text:
Consider the following statements and choose the correct code:
1. Equality before laws means that there should be equality of treatment under equal circumstances.
2. Right to equality means that equal should be equals, and unequals be unequals.
Codes:

solution.text: Both the statements are true.

question.text:
Which one of the following does not constitute part of our fundamental rights? Choose the correct code.
1. Right to life, liberty and security of person
2. Everyone has the right to own property.
3. Equal pay for equal work
4. Free education at the elementary stage

solution.text: Equal pay for equal work and free education at the elementary stage are part of the Directive Principles of State Policy.

question.text:
Consider the following statements with regard to the doctrine of severability and choose the correct code.
1. It relates to the whole statute and not merely to the offending provisions of the Act.
2. It relates to offending provision of the statute and not to the whole of it.

solution.text: Doctrine of severability is related to the offending provisions of the statute and not to the whole if it.

question.text:
Consider the following statements with regard to the Indecent Representation of Women (Prohibition) Act, 1986 and choose the correct code.
1. The Act extends to the whole country.
2. Indecent representation means, in addition to others, being derogatory to women.
Codes:

solution.text: Indecent Representation of Women (Prohibition) Act, 1986 indicates at something which is derogatory to women.

question.text:
Consider these statements with regard to Fundamental Rights incorporated in Part III of the Constitution. Choose the correct code.
1. Fundamental Rights constitute part of the basic structure.
2. What constitutes the basic structure is something which cannot be amended by the Parliament.

solution.text: Both the statements are true. 1 and 2 both are true.

question.text:
Consider these statements with regard to the National Commission on Backward Classes (NCBC) and choose the correct code.
1. The President appoints the chairman of NCBC.
2. The NCBC gives its report to the Central Government.

solution.text: Both the statements are true.

question.text: Which of the following comes within the category of the rarest of the rare crimes?

solution.text: Honour killing cames within the rarest of the rare crime.

question.text: Under Article 25(1), which of the following is not a reason for which restriction can be imposed on religion?

solution.text: All of the above constitute reasons for restrictions on religion under article 25(1).

question.text:
Freedom to manage religious affairs includes
1. To establish religions institutions
2. To manage their affairs
3. To own and acquire their property
4. To administer such property in accordance with law
Choose the code with the correct options.

solution.text: All the option came under managing the religions affairs.

question.text: The constitution of India is divided into certain parts. Which of the following forms part of the Fundamental Duties?

solution.text: Article IV A forms part of the fundamental duties.

question.text:
Consider the following statements with regard to secularism. Choose the correct one with the codes given.
1. Secularism promotes religions doctrines.
2. It separates religion and politics.
3. It denies state support to religious organizations.
4. It opposes religious ideas and ideology.

solution.text: Only Option 2 is true.

question.text:
Consider the following statements and choose the correct code:
1. No religions instructions is to be given in an educational institution wholly maintained by the State.
2. Comparative study of all religions does not amount to going against Article 28.

solution.text: Both the statements are true.

question.text: The finance commission is constituted to recommend criteria for

d.text: preparing the annual budget of union government
Distribution of financial resources between union and the states
Auditing the receipts and expenditures of the union government
